poem.title: A Song of Sixpence
poem.author: Peter McCarey
poem.text: The fanfare pealed and tinkered, a euphonious Traffic jam, the constable-conductor looking pleased (I'd plead on his behalf diminished Responsibility). The cabinet queued and peed in the common Or garden gardy-loo. The chancellor preened, unshaken Till he peered at the looking-glass And got quite peeved on account of its reluctance. Some oik, perhaps, had peeled its silver back To sell for sixpence. (The king, By all accounts, was sixpence short.)
